item.description:
Report X-2024120588

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-13T15:15:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-10
  • City: ORANGE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF Freight
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Drums arrived to service center 151 and were unloaded. No damage or leaks were noted at the time. When the freight was being prepped to be loaded into another trailer, it was discovered that one of the drums was leaking from a seal. The leak is contained to the drum and the pallet the drum is on. Sa fety advised CURA would be contacted to send a crew out to clean the drum and inspect the seal and move the drum into a recovery drum if necessary.

item.title: Report E-2024120218
item.description:
Report E-2024120218

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-13T15:15:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-10
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On December 10, 2024, five (5) 5-gallon pails of PF 300 had faulty packaging and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remove all spent product. All impacted material was containerized in seven (7) 30-gallon drums for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024120219
item.description:
Report E-2024120219

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-13T15:15:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-10
  • City: FARMINGTON
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On December 10, 2024, one (1) 55-gallond rum of UN1791 was punctured and released approximately fifteen (15) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EX Environmental (EXE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized neutralizing agents and absorbents to remove any spent product. The crew pump transfered the contents of the damaged 55-gallon drum into one (1) new 55-gallon drum. All impacted materials were containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024120232
item.description:
Report E-2024120232

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-13T15:15:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-07
  • City: FARRAGUT
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR INWAY, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On December 7, 2024, at 1751 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Farragut, TN regarding the release of BPW 76910 Antifoam. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of 0.5 gallons of BPW 76910 Antifoam (UN3082, 9, III) from (1) 330-gallon poly tote onto the trailer floor and asphalt parking lot. The release was reportedly due to a crack in the tote, impacting a 4’ x 6’ area on the trailer and a 1’ x 3’ area of asphalt. No drains or waterways were impacted by the release. The release was cleaned up with absorbents and the proper PPE. Contractors transferred the remaining product into a new 330-gallon poly tote to continue on with the client’s shipment and took the damaged tote off-site for proper disposal. All waste generated from addressing this release was containerized in (1) 55-gallon DM, which was then taken off site by the contractor for proper disposal.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At ~1900 hours, a Veolia driver picked up a tanker of DMF and piperidine to move it to a 3rd party transporter yard. The manway cover was not secure allowing liquid to spill from the tanker onto the soil. The Veolia emergency response number was called and EnviroServe was dispatched. EnviroServe estimated the spill affected 2000' X 10' of dirt. The affected soil was collected into roll off dumpsters for disposal. The NRC and CDPHE Emergency Reporting were contacted and Veolia received a call from the City and County of Denver Environmental Quality Duty Officer.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 35500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 14:02 PM ET, XDM contacted the call center to report a spill that occurred at a Fat Dog's truck stop, located at 1730 Highway 10 in Gibbon, NE. The spill consists of approximately 3 gallons or more of a UN2809 mercury, which released from a metallic cylinder contained inside of a wooden crate. The driver stated he cannot get close enough to inspect the cylinder and provide a trade name as the substance is too dangerous, and they are not in possession of a BOL either. The spill is inside the trailer and has leaked out onto the asphalt beneath the trailer. ERTS will dispatch a contractor to assist. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1 teaspoon of Mercury product and .5-gallon motor oil was released to trailer and asphalt due to load shift. The waste, PPE and impacted absorbents were containerized into (2) 55-gallon poly drums and Mercury waste was placed in a 5-gallon poly before it was placed in a (1) 35-gallon poly drum. The waste is staged for TSDF to pick up.

item.description:
Report E-2024120199

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-12T12:24:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-25
  • City: SALT LAKE CITY
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: EnviroServe was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted two areas measuring approximately 3ft-by-3ft of the trailer floor and 8ft-by-6ft of the concrete lot due to a puncture to one (1) 55-gallon metal drum. EnviroServe deployed granular absorbents to the areas and gathered the spent material and containerized it into two (2) 55-gallon metal drums. The damaged drum was overpacked into one (1) 65-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

  • City: GREENWOOD

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately a half (.5) gallon of material released from one (1) 1-gallon metal pail due to a forklift puncturing the pail. The material was Ultra 7000 U7209. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 5-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 17:36 PM ET, NBM contacted the call center to report a spill that occurred inside of a trailer in Bessemer, AL. The spill consists of approximately half a gallon of Carboguard 635 Part A, which released from 2–5-gallon metal pails due to a forklift blade puncturing the containers prior to arrival, impacting the trailer floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the terminal, who stated they cleaned the spill with absorbents and place the contents into 1–55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: On December 10, 2024, one (1) 50-pound bag of sodium hydroxide was torn during loading and released approximately two (2) pounds of product to the trailer interior. CERT personnel utilized a HEPA vacuum to remove all product, then utilized cleaners and absorbents to further remediate the site. All waste was containerized in three (3) 35-gallon drums of and one (1) 15-gallol drum for disposal.

  • Description: On December 6, 2024, two (2) 55-gallon drums of UN3469 were punctured by a forklift and released approximately forty (40) gallons of product to the loading dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the impacted site. All impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 95-gallon overpack and three (3) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one and a half (1.5) gallons of material released from one (1) 3,072-pound metal tote due to a loose valve resulting in a leak. The material released was Chemtrend PU14159. The release material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel used available PPE to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 5-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

  • City: WATERLOO

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Chicago Central and Pacific Railroad
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 20183
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 11-13-2024 A CN Mechanical employee observed liquid dripping from the bottom outlet valve of rail car # CBTX 737709 while performing an inbound train inspection at the CN Waterloo Yard in Waterloo, Iowa. The employee notified the CN Yard Coordinator who in turn made proper notifications to all departments. CN Dangerous Goods Contractor upon arrival and inspection found the bottom outlet valve cap to be less than tool tight and the bottom outlet valve handle to be in the fully closed position. CN Dangerous Goods Contractor upon arrival and inspection found the bottom outlet valve cap to be less than tool tight so they open and closed the the valve and replaced a damaged gasket and retightened to tool tight.

item.description:

  • City: WEST MEMPHIS
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Schneider Bulk Carriers
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On November 13, 2024, Schneider Bulk Carriers contacted Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) of a release in West Memphis, AR. It was reported 20-30 gallons of STEOL CS-460 was released due to a pinched dome lid gasket, the release impacted asphalt. No storm drains or waterways were impacted. Clean Harbors was dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up. Upon arrival CH reported there was rainwater in the impacted area a vac truck and frac truck was used for clean up. All clean up was completed and a 20,000 gallon frac truck and one 55-gallon drum of impacted water was generated. All waste was taken off-site for proper disposal.

item.title: Report I-2024110052
item.description:
Report I-2024110052

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-11T01:07:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-12
  • City: San Francisco
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: AMERICAN AIRLINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 293807
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Near completion of boarding Flight 2045 a customefs HP Laptop went into thermal runaway in their backpack under the seat near the back of the aircraft. Flames were issuing from the bag as the lithium ion batteries flared. The cabin of the aircraft quickly filled with smoke. The customefs father removed backpack from underseat and successfully bypassed the Flight Attendant and her commands in the aft of the cabin and threw the backpack with flaming laptop out onto the rampat San Francisco(SFO) International airport through one of the aft aircraft emergency exit doorways. Customers were panicking to evacuate. Flight Attendants opened 3 emergency exits on the aircraft and some customers exited slides onto the ramp below while others egressed through the main cabin door back onto the jetway and into the terminal.

  • Carrier/Reporter: ROADRUNNER TRANSPORTATION SYSTEMS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On December 6, 2024, Roadrunner Transportation Systems reported one 55-gallon metal drum of Zirconium Octoate (UN1993, 3, III) was damaged, resulting in the release of approximately 10 gallons of product. The release was contained to a 10 x 6 area of the trailer floor. Contractors were dispatched and cleaned up the release with absorbents, and simple green. The damaged drum was overpacked and forwarded on to the consignee. All was generated was containerized in (3) 55-gallon metal drums which were taken offsite pending proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024110473
item.description:
Report E-2024110473

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-10T12:24:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-11
  • City: MONTGOMERY
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 1500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 11/11/2024, 0835 hours, personnel in the CSXT Yard in Montgomery, Alabama discovered GATX 33805, a loaded tank car of Sulfuric Acid, leaking from the top of the car. The car was isolated and the shipper, Southern States Chemical, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report 2024-11-11-00087). Marion Environmental, Inc. (MEI), a CSXT response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found the frangible disk in the car’s non-reclosing pressure relief device had ruptured and approximately one gallon of product has slosh leaked onto the top of the car as a result. Contractor personnel replaced the blown rupture disk, verified a surge protector was present, confirmed appropriate outage in the tank, and decontaminated the top of the car. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper’s representative- Clay Chester (912-944-7107).

item.title: Report E-2024110380
item.description:
Report E-2024110380

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-10T12:24:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-11
  • City: CHATTANOOGA
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 1500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 11/11/2024, at 0709 hours, personnel in the CSXT Wauhatchie Yard in Chattanooga, Tennessee, discovered PROX32359, a tank car, residue: last contained, Butane leaking from the top of the car. The car was isolated and the shipper, Centennial Energy was notified via CHEMTREC (Report # 2024-11-11-00010). Marion Environmental Inc. (MEI), a CSXT response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found an active leak from the protective housing. Upon further inspection it was found to have the B-end liquid valve partially open; and the secondary closure plug less than tool tight with no thread tape applied. The vapor valve was also found to be partially open with the secondary closure plug less than tool tight without thread tape. Contractor personnel we able to close both valves, apply thread tape to the secondary plugs and secure them with a wrench. The issues identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper’s representative- Nick Petrosky (303-370-7102, npetrosky@centennialenergy.us).

item.description:

  • City: ALTOONA
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) gallon of material released from one (1) 5-gallon metal pail due to improper loading. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 5-gallon poly pail. The damaged pail was overpacked into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024120073
item.description:
Report E-2024120073

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-09T12:25:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-04
  • City: UTRECHT
  • State:
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: DURING THE PRE-LOAD OPERATIONS AT THE UPS UTRECHT FACILITY IN THE NETHERLANDS ONE PACKAGE FELT WARM TO THE TOUCH AND SHOWED SIGNS OF SMOKE. THE PACKAGE WAS IMMEDIATELY REMOVED FROM THE BUILDING AND SECURED. THERE WERE NO VISIBLE FLAMES OBSERVED. DURING INNER CONTENT INSPECTION THERE IS EVIDENCE OF BURNING, MELTING, AND CHARRING OF THE INNER CONTENTS. THE INCIDENT PACKAGE WAS MARKED AND LABELLED AS UN3480, LITHIUM ION BATTERIES, SECTION IA OF PACKING INSTRUCTION 965 WITH A CARGO AIRCRAFT ONLY AND CLASS 9 LITHIUM BATTERY LABEL. THE PACKAGE WAS PART OF A THREE PACKAGE SHIPMENT WITH AN APPROPRIATE IATA SHIPPERS DECLARATION AND HAD PASSED AN ACCEPTANCE AUDIT IN HONG KONG ON 15-NOV-2024. THE PACKAGE HAD PREVIOUSLY FLOWN ON UPS AIRCRAFT FROM HKG - SHJ - CGN BEFORE EXPERIENCING THE THERMAL EVENT IN UTRECHT, NETHERLANDS. THERE ARE TWO ADDITIONAL PACKAGES IN THE SHIPMENT THAT WERE ALSO REMOVED AND SECURED, TRACKING NUMBERS 1Z802E150499401436 AND 1Z802E150495846446. THESE TWO PACKAGES WERE NOT INVOLVED IN THE LITHIUM BATTERY EVENT. THE PACKAGE WAS REPORTED TO THE NATIONAL RESPONSE CENTER ON 04-DEC-2024, REPORT NUMBER 1417932.

UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED ONE HONDA EU1000I PORTABLE INVERTER GENERATOR WITH FUEL IN THE TANK. THE FUEL WAS SLOSHING AROUND CAUSING THE GENERATOR TO LEAK FROM THE CLOSURE. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM COLORADO USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 50X763, THE UPS STORE, 3531 S LOGAN ST, ENGLEWOOD CO 80113-3700. PRIOR TO THE UNDECLARED DISCOVERY THE PACKAGE WAS FLOWN FROM ONT TO ANC.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: DURING X-RAY SCREENING IN DUBAI, UNITED ARAB EMIRATES, TWO AIR PACKAGES FROM USA TO EGYPT WERE FOUND TO CONTAIN AEROSOL PRODUCTS THAT ARE REGULATED IN TRANSPORTATION. PACKAGE TRACKING NUMBER 1Z24E0636741898271 CONTAINS TWO INNER BOXES EACH WITH TWELVE FLAMMABLE AEROSOL CANS OF CANTESCO ZINC GALV SPRAY. THE INNER TWO BOXES CONTAINING THE AEROSOL PRODUCTS ARE PREPRINTED WITH GROUND LIMITED QUANTITY MARKS. PACKAGE TRACKING NUMBER 1Z24E0636742217487 CONTAINS TWELVE FLAMMABLE AEROSOL CANS OF CANTESCO SOLVENT CLEANER, TWELVE FLAMMABLE AEROSOL CANS OF CANTESCO ZINC GALV SPRAY, AND TWELVE NON-FLAMMABLE AEROSOL CANS OF CANTESCO WATER BASED ANTI-SPLATTER. THESE INNER BOXES ARE ALSO PREPRINTED WITH GROUND LIMITED QUANTITY MARKS. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON EITHER OF THE OUTERMOST FIBERBOARD BOXES.

item.title: Report E-2024120047
item.description:
Report E-2024120047

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-09T12:25:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-12
  • City: CHEYENNE
  • State: WY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PIONEER TANK LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: The drivers left the shippers facility enroute to the final destination. Upon entering highway traffic, the driver encountered vehicles that were not merging correctly and driving aggressively. They brake checked each other and the truck driver had to do emergency braking maneuver to avoid collision with the 2 other vehicles. The load shifted forward, and 2 IBCs shifted and pushed barrels together after the load securement failed. The drum of ferric chloride was crushed by one of the other barrels, causing a crack at the bottom corner of the barrel. The duration of the release was approximately 1.5 hours. The local fire department was called and was on scene along with WY DOT personnel as it happened at the Wyoming Port of Entry. The Laramie County fire department had sand delivered and built a berm and used absorbent to stop the spread of the spill. Clean Harbors was contacted by the company to handle the remediation. The fire department left the scene once the leak stopped and Clean Harbors was enroute from Denver, CO. Clean Harbors unloaded the trailer in order to find the compromised drum, which was put into a 95-gallon overpack to contain and neutralize it with soda ash. The crew then decontaminated the trailer using a mix of water and speedy dry. All waste associated with the decontamination was then shoveled and wiped into a 55-gallon poly drum which was picked up the following day.
